column4: hi @all, anyone can help me about my partition http://imm.io/zg9k Is that a correct paritioning?
it works but i don't know why you would want them that big
thanks for the reply. That's my HD size. I'm planning to partition it, d: and e:
do you need a 200+gb root partition?
hehehe, I'm new to ubuntu os, that's why I don't if I have correct partitioning. Can you please give an advice. Thank you.
how many OS's are you going to have on the disk?
just ubuntu
any reason you have a swap partition inside an extended?
no, I just followed the installation tutorial in youtube.
well it must be a bad tutorial if it suggests that layout
wew, yeah! she said it should be the twice of my RAM.
thats not the issue, why is it in an extended partition?
I'm not really sure. :(
Should delete it?
its doing no harm, it just doesn't make any sense
ah I see, but I can remove it in the future right? using gparted?
you'd need to recreate the swap partition afterward but yeah
ah ok
so what do you suggest now? Should I delete it? /sda1 and /sda5
up to you
but I just can't. delete option is disabled.
you have to delete the partition inside first
to do that you need to swapoff if it is in use
yes, I just deleted the partition: http://imm.io/zgrt
